intro: Lotoxalis berlandieri, commonly known as the Mexican bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to purple. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun, often found in desert or arid environments. Its leaves are opposite and lance-shaped, while its fruits are small, capsule-like structures that contain several seeds. Lotoxalis berlandieri is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting local pollinators.
